comment.author: 43854658@N00
comment._content: James B. Duke House – Then and Now (94+ years later) "One of the great surviving mansions of "Millionaire's Row" on Fifth Avenue, the New York University Institute of Fine Arts was built originally as the James B. and Nanaline Duke home in 1912, and was designed by Horace Trumbauer." [1] James Buchanan Duke (1856 - 1925) was one of the founding partners of the American Tobacco Company and the owner of Duke Power. He was the founder of Duke University. The Duke family donated the building to New York University in 1952. [2] [3] "James B. Duke House (c.1912)" by Bain News "NYU Institute of Fine Arts (2006)" by yeussquai

comment.author: 11572312@N00
comment._content: Link to the NYU IFA website (with a cool picture of the interior staircase: www.nyu.edu/gsas/dept/fineart/ifa/research/libraries.htm The Stephen Chan Library of Fine Arts is located on the second floor of the Duke House at 1 East 78th Street. Location is on 5th Avenue, adjacent to Central Park, New York, NY.

comment._content: Thank you both so much for your research on this magnificent house both past and present.  We'll fill in the caption, and provide a better approximation of the date the next time that we update the record.
